title: Measurement of inelastic neutron scattering cross section of Fe-56.

section of Fe-56.

x4codes.shortRef: Jour: Nucl. Instrum. Methods in Physics Res., Sect.A, Vol.575, p.449 (2007)

x4freetext: Details of setup.
Superconducting Electron Linac.
nELBE source fast neutrons from 0.1 to 10 MeV.
Electrons are accelerated up to 40 MeV using
Electron Linac for beams with high Brilliance and low
Emittance ELBE.
Bremsstrahlung radiation is induced by impinging
a high intensity electron beam on a liquid lead loop.
Fast neutrons are generated via photonuclear
reactions on lead.
Conical collimator with an entrance diameter of 2 cm,
exit diameter of 3 cm is used to let a defined beam
of neutrons pass through the 2.4 m thick wall.
Neutron energy distribution of the nELBE neutron source
was measured with U-235 fission chamber at flight path
of 430 cm, shows Maxwellian type.
The neutron source strength at the nominal beam current
was calculated with MCNP-4C3 to be 10**13 neutrons/s.
Experimental spectrum extends from 200 keV to 10 MeV
peaking at around 2 MeV; is given on Fig.2 of
J,EPJ/CS,8,07007,2010; Fig.4 of S,ISINN-18 .
Neutron intensity on target was 4*10**4 n/s/cm**2.
U-235 fission chamber to measure primary
neutron flux.
Array of 5 plastic scintillators of
100 cm length, 4.2 cm width, 1.1 cm thickness with low
detection threshold to detect the scattered neutron.
Array of up to 42 BaF2 hexagonally shaped
crystals (length 20 cm, inner diameter 53mm) to detect
the de-excitation gamma-rays.
All detectors have time resolutions of about 600 ps.
Energy resolution about 1 % at EN about 1 MeV.
Efficiency of the unshielded plastic scintillators was
measured with quasi-monoenergetic neutrons at the PTB,
Braunschweig, at five different neutron energies
between 29 and 1202 keV. In addition, the efficiency
was measured in situ relative to the fission chamber
to cover the whole energy spectrum - plastic
scintillators were surrounded by 1 cm thick Pb shield.
Cylindrical slab of natural iron.
Isotopic composition: Fe-54 - 5.85%, Fe-56 - 91.75%,
Double-time-of-flight method.
Flight path several meters.
Gammas-neutrons coincidence.
Sample-out measurement was normalized to the same
count rate like in the sample-in measurement, at
energies higher than inelastic scattering signature.
Then the normalized sample-out measurement was
subtracted from the sample-in measurement. From the
resulting distribution, the incoming neutron flux
measured by the U-235 fission chamber and the
efficiencies of the different detectors one can
calculate the cross section.
Corrections for multiple scattering in the target,
scattering of neutrons on air and on the angular
correlation of the emitted gamma-ray and scattered
neutron still have to be included.
This work was supported by the European Commission
in the FP6-I3 project EFNUDAT (European Facilities for
Nuclear Data measurements) and by the German federal
ministry of education and research (BMBF) under project
number 02NUK013A.
M.M.
Request of data was sent to R.Beyer and A.Junghans,
roland.beyer@fzd.de , a.junghans@fzd.de 20-07-2011.
Inelastic neutron scattering cross section to the first
excited state.

flag.help: Reference to related data compiled in another entry

x4freetext: Good agreement with measurements by Perey+ up to the
threshold of the second excited level at 2085 keV.
Relative total uncertainty as dependence from incident
neutron energy is on Fig.5 of J,EPJ/CS,8,07006,2010.
Uncertainties at 2 MeV incident neutron energy:
Statistical uncertainty (including empty
target subtraction) - about 5%.
Uncertainty due to neutron primary intensity
statistics by fission chamber - about 3.%.
Uncertainty of fission chamber efficiency -
about 3.8%.
Uncertainty due to geometrical scaling (fission
chamber) - about 1.%
Uncertainty of BaF2 array detection efficiency
- about 1.5%.
Uncertainty of Plastic scintillators detection
efficiency - about 3.2%.
Total error at EN=2 MeV - about 8.%.
Request of data was sent to R.Beyer and A.Junghans,
roland.beyer@fzd.de , a.junghans@fzd.de 20-07-2011;
to A.Wagner a.wagner@fzd.de 22-09-2011.
Preliminary data on:
Fig.6 of S,ISINN-18,127,2011,
